snippet: The Census Bureau rejected a claim by the Bloomberg administration that at least 50,000 residents of Brooklyn and Queens had been overlooked.
abstract: United States Census Bureau, rebuffing a challenge by Mayor Michael R Bloomberg, announces that it will not change its 2010 population total for New York City; Bloomberg administration had argued in 2011 that at least 50,000 residents of Brooklyn and Queens had been overlooked in federal data.
lead_paragraph: The Census Bureau rejected a claim by the Bloomberg administration that at least 50,000 residents of Brooklyn and Queens had been overlooked.

headline.seo: Census Numbers for N.Y.C. Won’t Change, Bureau Says
headline.main: Census Numbers for City Won’t Change, Bureau Says
headline.print_headline: Census Numbers for City Won’t Change, Bureau Says
